quest.name: Absent without Leave
journal:
 Quest Sync
Wrenric has more than his share of concerns, the morale of his men chief among them.

dialogue.name: WRENRIC
dialogue.text: Psst! Do you have a moment?

dialogue.name: WRENRIC
dialogue.text: Please keep this to yourself, but one of my men has been acting strangely of late.

dialogue.name: WRENRIC
dialogue.text: As I am sure you can appreciate, there are certain things that the guards here, myself included, may not wish to discuss openly. I had hoped that you, as an outsider, may be able to find out what is troubling him.

dialogue.name: WRENRIC
dialogue.text: He is currently stationed a short distance south from here. If you could lend him your ear, I would be most grateful.

dialogue.name: WRENRIC
dialogue.text: I will not pretend that our life here is a happy one. We must grasp what scant joy we can.

dialogue.name: GUARDA03369
dialogue.text: What brings you all the way out here?

dialogue.name: GUARDA03369
dialogue.text: So, you've been talking to Wrenric. Well, if you must know, I was thinking about leaving this place.

dialogue.name: GUARDA03369
dialogue.text: It was all getting too much for me, and I felt like I was losing my mind one day at a time. Me and one of the others were planning on making a clean break, putting the Inn behind us.

dialogue.name: GUARDA03369
dialogue.text: But after seeing you and Alisaie, I changed my mind. I'm staying here, at least for the time being.

dialogue.name: GUARDA03369
dialogue.text: Could you give a message to my friend? He's the one I was going to run away with, a Galdjent chap. I'm not sure exactly where he'll be, but the watchman southeast of the Inn should know.

dialogue.name: GUARDA03369
dialogue.text: Tell him that I'm staying. I'd go myself, but I can't abandon my post. Please, I've got to let him know.

dialogue.name: GUARDA03369
dialogue.text: I can't stand the thought of leaving him there to wait for me. At least if he knows I'm not going, he can make up his own mind about whether to stay or go.

dialogue.name: GUARDB03369
dialogue.text: Galdjent bloke on patrol? You've just missed him, I'm afraid.

dialogue.name: GUARDB03369
dialogue.text: Said he wanted a breath of fresh air, so he went for a stroll. I tried tellin' him the air's no fresher up there than it is here, but would he listen? Would he bollocks! Anyway, last I saw, he was headin' north.

dialogue.name: GUARDB03369
dialogue.text: Any luck? Knowin' him, he probably went and strolled right over the side of a cliff or summink.

dialogue.name: GUARDC03369
dialogue.text: I remember you... One of Alisaie's friends...

dialogue.name: GUARDC03369
dialogue.text: Staying? I thought so... That's why I left...by myself. Reckoned I'd get a bit further...before being attacked by...beasts, though. Just my...bloody luck.

dialogue.name: GUARDC03369
dialogue.text: Can you tell him...I went alone, that I got away? Wouldn't want him to...blame himself.

dialogue.name: GUARDC03369
dialogue.text: It's my own fault...he was set on staying...but I talked him into...leaving. I should've listened...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: There's no response. It's just a corpse.

dialogue.name: GUARDA03369
dialogue.text: So, did you give him the message?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: He left Amh Araeng by himself.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: He's gone.

dialogue.name: GUARDA03369
dialogue.text: Well, I'm glad he didn't stay on my account. I wouldn't want to hold him back from finding a new life elsewhere.

dialogue.name: GUARDA03369
dialogue.text: When you say it like that, it sounds almost as if─ Oh... I see.

dialogue.name: GUARDA03369
dialogue.text: Still, I stand by my decision. It is the right thing to do, I know it.

dialogue.name: GUARDA03369
dialogue.text: Come to think of it, Wrenric is probably wondering what's going on. If it's not too much to ask, would you mind speaking with him?

dialogue.name: WRENRIC
dialogue.text: Is that so? Hmm... It is better than both of them being killed. We should be thankful for small mercies. In any case, I appreciate what you have done for us.
